metadata.name: HackTool - Windows Credential Editor (WCE) Execution
metadata.comment: Detects the use of Windows Credential Editor (WCE)

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND (contains(lower(process.file.hashes.value), lower('imphash=a53a02b997935fd8eedcb5f7abab9b9f')) OR contains(lower(process.file.hashes.value), lower('imphash=e96a73c7bf33a464c510ede582318bf2')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.exe -s')) AND endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\\\services.exe'))) AND NOT endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\clussvc.exe')))

output.summary: Detects the use of Windows Credential Editor (WCE)

metadata.objective: False positive: Another service that uses a single -s command line switch Reference: https://www.ampliasecurity.com/research/windows-credentials-editor/
